greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: a(n) = A108548(A163511(n)).
comment: This irregular table can be represented as a binary tree. Each child to the left is obtained by doubling the parent, and each child to the right is obtained by applying A332818 to the parent:
This is the mirror image of the tree in A332815.
link: Antti Karttunen, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..16383
Index entries for sequences related to binary expansion of n
Index entries for sequences that are permutations of the natural numbers
program: A108546list(up_to) = { my(v=vector(up_to), p,q); v[1] = 2; v[2] = 3; v[3] = 5; for(n=4,up_to, p = v[n-2]; q = nextprime(1+p); while(q%4 != p%4, q=nextprime(1+q)); v[n] = q); (v); };
xref: Cf. A108546 (the right edge of the tree from 2 downward).
results.author: _Antti Karttunen_, Mar 05 2020
